net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.config

Class SearchIndexerConfigurationBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.search.base.config.AbstractSearchConfigurationBean
      • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.config.SearchIndexerConfigurationBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchConfiguration, SearchIndexerConfiguration

    public class SearchIndexerConfigurationBean
extends AbstractSearchConfigurationBean
implements SearchIndexerConfiguration
    This is the implementation of SearchIndexerConfiguration as JAXB-ready Java-Bean.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • getNonUtfEncoding

        public String getNonUtfEncoding()
        If you are indexing locations that contain textual content with different encodings you can enable automatic unicode detection by omitting the SearchIndexerDataLocation.getEncoding(). In this case if a file has an unspecified encoding, unicode encodings will be detected automatically. Otherwise this non unicode decoding is used as fallback. If not explicitly set, EncodingUtil.ENCODING_ISO_8859_15 is used.
        Specified by:
        getNonUtfEncoding in interface SearchIndexerConfiguration
        Returns:
        the non-unicode encoding.

      • setNonUtfEncoding

        public void setNonUtfEncoding(String nonUtfEncoding)
        Parameters:
        nonUtfEncoding - is the nonUtfEncoding to set

      • getFilters

        public Collection<FilterRuleChain<String>> getFilters()
        This method gets the List of Filters that decide which resources should be indexed.
        Returns:
        the Collection with the FilterRuleChains.
        See Also:
        SearchIndexerDataLocation.getFilter()
